name: BEST WESTERN Primrose Hotel Downtown-Toronto

reviews.text: We checked into this hotel July 27, 2007 and stayed one night on our own before our fellow tour members were to arrive. I asked if it were possible to put me in a room that I could also remain during our tour; so as to forego a room change. Well, I was assigned a room on the 6th floor, which was dirty (we kept our shoes on), and badly in need of renovation. The first night, the room next to ours had a get-together at loud voices talking at 3 am. I called the front desk to complain and things finally piped down. The next day when other tour members arrived, I mentioned my disappointing room and was informed the 'other' rooms were better. Sure enough, the rooms up on the 21st floor did look like they had been renovated. Unfortunately, there were no rooms for us to change until the last night. Ugh. I was just grossed out by the room and bath. When we were changed, the view improved, the neighboring rooms were quiet, but the overall cleanliness of the hotel was pretty bad. The elevators were frighteningly slow; and with 48 or so tour members trying to come and go on time, was just impossible.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel and its elevators

likes.disliked: — lack of cleanliness and slow elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is rated as a 2-3 star depending on what reviews you read. I was concerned when I saw the pictures and read the reviews of this hotel.
reviews.title: Please read, detailed review - Primrose is fine

likes.disliked: — Slow elevator, but I did know before going.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quick and it was a busy long weekend in Toronto. Staff will ask if you want smoking or non, and king or two double during checkin. Ask for a high floor. I forgot to ask but noticed we were on a high floor when handed the pass cards for our room. There are smoking and non-smoking floors. We were on the 17th with a beautiful view of the city. There is a pool on the third floor, we didn't go down but people were using it.
reviews.title: Avoid the Best Western Primrose

likes.disliked: — The crime, staff, heating/air conditioning, elevators.

reviews.text: Staff are friendly and take the time to explain how to find parking etc. The underground hotel parking is now $23. The lot was full and we safely parked at Wood and Church in a city lot for $15. It is less than that if you are leaving by 6 am. There are two more parking lots just south of the hotel on either side of the street but wanted $30 for the night. A note about parking anywhere in Toronto - park by one of the lights, remove anything that is visible from your car. This includes face plate from your stereo, CDs. Keep your car clean and nobody will be interested.
reviews.title: Kind of a dump.

reviews.text: I have included a picture of the bedroom and the bathroom. The room was clean and well maintained. If I had to take a guess I'd say that it was renovated in the past year or two.
reviews.title: Completely God-awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I decided to stay at the Primrose after a wedding downtown and was pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff. We arrived before the check in time so we could get ready, and the staff made a huge effort to go out of their way to get us a room quickly so we could be on time. The rooms were a lot bigger than I thought they would be, and we had a great view of the lake from the 17th floor. The room was really nice and clean, and the duvets were nice compared to the stiff sheets i am used to in hotels. Overall, I would say that the price we paid for the room was well worth it. The Tim Hortons in the lobby was an added bonus too. I would stay here again if I ever need to stay downtown again.
reviews.title: better than i was expecting

likes.disliked: — ask for a south facing room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Stayed at the BW Primrose in early october.
reviews.title: Clean and Comfy.

reviews.text: Stayed in a king bed room on the 17th floor. Room was large and clean, bathroom was nice, looks like it was newly renovated. Our room had a south view of the city with a fantistic view of downtown and the lake. The staff was really nice and helpful and directed me to the nearest tourist attractions.
reviews.title: What a dump

likes.disliked: — Think the review speaks for itself

reviews.text: The underground parking in the hotel was $15 a day, but you do get in/out privileges, just use caution when parking, it's a bit tight down there.
reviews.title: Student residence program but has some info to help tourists.

likes.liked: — the view. Get a view facing south, if you are on floor 9 and below and facing north you face into another building

reviews.title: Very satisfied for the Price
reviews.text: The Internet was complimentary(wireless) made it convienent to check my email from my room.
This hotel is right on the edge of a very dangerous part of town.
reviews.title: One of the Two Worst Hotels I have Stayed in

likes.liked: — the subway station a couple of blocks away

reviews.text: The rooms are filthy. I am attaching photos so that you can see the room I had.
reviews.title: It has some good points

reviews.text: Also, be aware that the airport bus does NOT stop at this hotel. You can walk from the bus stop (at Delta Chelsea), but again you will be walking past/with prostitutes and homeless people if you have to make the walk during the hours it is dark.
reviews.title: Awful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people working there were fine. I have nothing negative to say about them. Also, the subway is easily accessible. It is just a really dumpy hotel. I am still surprised to see the website and see words like "elegant" and "luxurious" even in the same sentence.
reviews.title: Mmmm, It was okay, I guess

likes.disliked: — Room had a musty odour - probably from smokers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I talked to someone in the elevator, and his room was just as bad according to him. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although supposed to be upgraded the rooms (bedroom, bathroom and lounge) all need immediate refurbishment scruffy furniture. Also the air-conditioning had a mind of its own, it was expensive for what we had. Avoid the restaurant at all costs only one house red/white
reviews.title: Aviod if possible
Spend a little more to get a lot more!
reviews.text: The Best Western Primrose Hill is in dire need of a face lift, it does however fit inf or the area it is in. While being pretty close to the university and Maple Leaf Gardens, the area is dominated by the homeless and prostitutes.

We booked one of their junior suites, being that we were staying for 4 nights and thought we could cook our own food a couple of nights to save a bit of money, but even though they supply a cooker and microwave, they don't supply any pots, pans or utensils!? We did cook one night using the grill, and it was so smokey from not being cleaned previously that it set off the smoke alarm! luckily only the in room one and not the one connected to the whole building.
reviews.title: do not use the lifts/elevators - The 'Worst' Best Western hotel

likes.liked: — Free wireless Internet - I had to find something to put here!
likes.disliked: — Not enough space - Top of the list - lifts/elevators!

reviews.text: As most people have already noted that the lifts are very slow, and the whole hotel has a musty and or bleach smell. The bathrooms are tired and need to have the tiles replaced, or at least thoroughly cleaned to remove the mould stains.
reviews.title: Don't Use the Safety Deposit Boxes at this Hotel !

reviews.text: I would recomend either staying at a hostel or spending the $10 extra to stay at some of the nicer hotels down near the waterfront.
reviews.title: I Am So Scared, The Best Western Primrose Will Always Haunt Me...

likes.liked: — The View was nice, make sure to request a room with a view of the CN Tower, otherwise you get a view of the dirty neighbourhood

description: Located in the Heart of Downtown Toronto, our attention to detail service awaits you! Tastefully appointed oversized guest rooms, free hybrid wireless internet, business center, lobby bar & restaurant, on-site Tim Hortons Coffee and outdoor seasonal pool are a few of the services and features of this Three-Diamond AAA Hotel :: Largest Best Western in Canada!
